image.altText: a global weather graph with the words la nina written over it

props.synopsis: The current edition of La Niña is not playing by the rule book — for only the second time in 75 years its onset has arrived in the middle of summer.

title.children: La Niña conditions underway in unusual summer appearance

image.altText: Sign saying price reduced on real estate for sale.

props.synopsis: China's property crash is bad news for Australia's economy, and there's even a risk it could precipitate our own housing crisis.

title.children: China's property crash a warning for Australia's housing market

image.altText: Kamala Harris stands in the rostrum in the House of Representatives, a US flag behind her.

props.synopsis: The January 6 certification ceremony was free of the chaos and violence of four years ago, but undoubtedly still uncomfortable for its presiding officer, Kamala Harris.

title.children: Harris presides over certification of Donald Trump's win

image.altText: Justin Trudeau, dressed in a black winter coat, stands at a microphone in front of a red-brick wall with greenery on it.

props.synopsis: Justin Trudeau will end his nine years in power, following increasing pressure from his own party to step down.

title.children: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announces plan to resign

image.altText: person who is blurred walks in front of the new york stock exchange, sign says wall street

props.synopsis: Analysts point to optimism about the US economy, but much will ride on decisions made by US president-elect Donald Trump, and the direction of interest rates both here in Australia and overseas.

title.children: Analysts issue warning as more Australians dive into Wall Street

image.altText: A young girl lies in a hospital bed. The skin on her face is red and inflamed and her arm is covered in plastic.

props.synopsis: Daniella Jacobs-Herd faces a decade of skin grafts after suffering severe burns from a Temu jumper purchased online, which failed to comply with Australian safety standards.

title.children: Girl suffers severe burns after Temu jumper ignites 'in a split second'

image.altText: A fire damaged grandstand.

props.synopsis: Firefighters worked quickly to contain the fire at the heritage-listed racecourse in Melbourne's south-east early Tuesday morning.

title.children: Police investigate suspicious fire in stands at Caulfield Racecourse

image.altText: Two old men sit on a tram, one types on a lap top

props.synopsis: Studies show social connectedness leads to better health outcomes for men. Jack and Richard's lifelong friendship offers a masterclass in the power of mateship.

title.children: Jack and Richard met in 1964. The power of mateship changed their lives

image.altText: israeli emergency workers gather around a mini bus that was allegedly shot at by palestinians

props.synopsis: Two women in their 60s and a man about 40 years old were pronounced dead at the scene, while seven passengers were wounded, Israel's ambulance service said.

title.children: Three Israelis killed in northern West Bank attack, says ambulance service

image.altText: people on platform with trains

props.synopsis: The new protected industrial action will start from January 15 and initially last for three days but it could continue if the stand-off is not resolved.

title.children: Sydney trains industrial action to resume next week

image.altText: Nikki Glaser

props.synopsis: This year's Golden Globes had an first-time win for 62-year-old Demi Moore, another awards sweep for Shōgun, and celebrity lookalikes on the red carpet.

title.children: Golden Globes: Nikki Glaser's 'pope-ular' song, Demi Moore's first big win

image.altText: A close-up shot of a doctor noting down symptoms of a patient on a form with a stethoscope hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor has been accused of discrimination for cancelling a teenage transgender patient's routine appointment for adolescent vaccinations.

title.children: Human rights complaint made after transgender teen's GP visit cancelled

image.altText: Man in bright ski gear skis down christmas decorated street

props.synopsis: Governors across the US declare states of emergency after heavy snowfall closed federal offices and public schools, left homes and businesses without power, disrupted travel and left motorists stranded.

title.children: US governors declare state of emergency amid major winter storm

image.altText: Two US warships in a training exercise in the Pacific Ocean.

props.synopsis: A report on an emergency exercise released under Freedom of Information reveals how Australia's dependency on imported fuel could leave it vulnerable to geopolitical tensions.

title.children: Home fuel security falls short as 'war-game' report reveals weaknesses

image.altText: The AI Lucas, a tall, grey-haired blue-eyed man standing inside a kitchen.

props.synopsis: As the popularity of AI-generated companions grows, there are calls for greater regulation of a rapidly expanding world that some fear is disconnecting users from real-life human relationships.

title.children: AI partners are on the rise, raising complex questions for our society

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios and Novak Djokovic embrace in mid-court as a packed crowd cheers behind them after a match.

props.synopsis: The scenes that greeted Nick Kyrgios and Novak Djokovic's doubles matches at the Brisbane International were among the most raucous of the entire week, but seven-time major winner Jamie Murray says doubles is dying.

title.children: Kyrgios and Djokovic show doubles draws crowds, but elsewhere it's dying

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis pumps his first after winning a point

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis overcomes a tough examination from Yoshihito Nishioka as Christopher O'Connell also secures a win at Memorial Drive.

title.children: Thanasi Kokkinakis headlines Australian winners in Adelaide

image.altText: A man appearing to be searching for something, standing amid rocks and sparse bush in a desert landscape.

props.synopsis: When Harold Lasseter died in a lonely desert grave in 1931, he took secrets of a supposed vast gold-bearing reef with him. His tale inspired generations of expeditions, which continue to this day.

title.children: Search continues for Lasseter's elusive gold reef, almost a century on

image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: The ABC has obtained a more detailed cost estimate for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, with newly released information showing a cost of $171 million over 30 years for maintenance and upkeep — on top of its construction cost.

title.children: More costs revealed for Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium

image.altText: A digital render of the wind farm nearby a mine site

props.synopsis: After seeing the success of solar power onsite, the Dugald River zinc mine is now looking to harness the power of wind in a "first" for Queensland. The company wants to become carbon neutral by 2050.

title.children: Outback mine hopes to be first in Queensland powered by wind

image.altText: man dressed in black archbishop robes raises his hands

props.synopsis: During Trump's first administration, Cardinal McElroy sharply criticised his plan to launch a mass deportation campaign targeting millions of immigrants living in the United States.

title.children: Pope names Trump critic as Washington DC's new archbishop

image.altText: Three men in yellow jumpsuits manage ropes on a ship

props.synopsis: The International Transport Workers' Federation says it recovered $30.7 million in stolen wages for the "world's invisible workforce" last year.

title.children: 'Modern slavery': Seafarers face stolen pay, limited food, dirty water

image.altText: Small girl and boy on aqua blue waterslide

props.synopsis: An ambitious foreshore development transforms a rural town on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula into tourist destination, rather than a "toilet stop" for travellers.

title.children: Controversial $11m water park and marina help save drought-hit town

image.altText: White foam is sprayed from a yellow fire truck towards a plane that is parked on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: Passengers describe feeling the Etihad Airways plane speeding up as it travelled down the runway before being jolted as the plane braked suddenly and came to a halt.

title.children: Passengers praise crew's 'calm' handling of aborted Melbourne take-off

image.altText: a picture of tree branches in front of the sky

props.synopsis: A tree expert says many are unaware how dangerous trees can be and urges people to look up for the warning signs.

title.children: Recent deaths and injuries from falling trees prompt arborist warning

image.altText: A group of police officers walk down a street in front of a shop front at night

props.synopsis: South Australian police officers will be deployed to Alice Springs, following calls for assistance from the Northern Territory police commissioner.

title.children: SA police officers deployed to Alice Springs amid ongoing crime

image.altText: A woman slumps in front a laptop.

props.synopsis: What causes chronic work boredom? And what are some practical things you can do to make work more bearable if leaving isn't an option?

title.children: Chronic boredom at work can lead to burnout but there are things you can do

image.altText: Amelia, wearing headphones and facing towards a moving train away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Sensitivity to everyday sounds is a common disorder, especially among autistic people such as Amelia Geiss. But what causes it and how can we help manage it?

title.children: My autism makes me sensitive to sound, but I've learnt to turn down the volume

image.altText: A graphic of a girl with social media icons around her head

props.synopsis: Researchers believe a public health response could be more effective than the federal government's upcoming social media ban for teenagers under 16.

title.children: 'Evidence is weak': Child psychiatrist criticises youth social media ban

image.altText: Police vehicles in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A man has died after he was shot by police during an incident in Adelaide's south in the early hours of this morning, SA Police has said.

title.children: Man dies after being shot by police at home in Adelaide's south

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and wearing a green vest

props.synopsis: Police say new intelligence has led them to search an area of bushland west of Geelong for missing Bannockburn woman Lorrin Whitehead. She hasn't been seen since leaving her home in 2013.

title.children: Police to search bushland for missing Victorian woman Lorrin Whitehead

image.altText: An oil slick on the ocean surface with a tanker in the background.

props.synopsis: The energy giant has pleaded guilty to causing an oil spill in 2022, that leaked 25,000 litres of oil off WA's north-west coast. Santos will pay a $10,000 fine and $9,700 in court costs for failing to prevent the spill.

title.children: Gas giant Santos fined $10,000 for 25,000-litre oil spill off Pilbara coast

image.altText: Nusra Latif Qureshi, with long brown hair and long bright blue dress, stands smiling in a room with bright painting on wall.

props.synopsis: In her first major solo exhibition, Melbourne-based Nusra Latif Qureshi takes her deep understanding of Mughal painting and Urdu storytelling traditions, and brings her own powerful perspective to them.

title.children: Artist Nusra Latif Qureshi refuses to paint women as symbols of beauty
